item.title: Kristina add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "I was always treated as if I had insisted on being born, in opposition to the dictates of reason, religion, and morality, and against the dissuadinig arguments of my best friends." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "We were equals afterwards, as we had been before; but, afterwards at quiet times when I sat looking at Joe and thinking about him, I had a new sensation of feeling conscious that I was looking up to Joe in my heart." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "In the little world in which children have their existence, whosoever brings them up, there is nothing so finely perceived and so finely felt as injustice." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There have been occasions in my later life (I suppose as in most lives) when I have felt for a time as if a thick curtain had fallen on all its interest and romance, to shut me out from anything save dull endurance any more. Never has that curtain dropped so heavy and blank, as when my way in life lay stretched out straight before me through the newly-entered road of apprenticeship to Joe." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kristina add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Winston Churchhill
item.description: "We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give." -- Winston Churchhill
